page.title: 15Local issues in Kingston
page.content: The bypass:It was thought of in 1965 by the Ministry of Transport.The people on the Blandy estate have signed a petition against it.Work is due to start in 1987. The New Village hall:A new hall is being built on Draycott Road in Southmoor.Building started during the summer of 1984. Despite a lot of opposition from people of Draycott Road,plans went ahead and building began.The main complaint was that a usually quiet road would be disrupted.In Southmoor generally,they decided that a new village hall was needed and so a committee was set up to organise fund raising for this expensive project. Tennis court:If they have enough money they are planning to build a tennis court behind the new village hall.
